result.execSummary:
The defendant Danira S Cameron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Due to financial hardship, Court ordered all costs, fees and surcharges  waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danira S Cameron

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 4 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Due to financial hardship, Court ordered all costs, fees and surcharges waived.  Court ordered cash bail transferred to 15CF595.

Court ordered the no-contact order be modified and amended to a no violent contact order. All other conditions as to bond will continue and all conditions as to contact as ordered by children's court be followed.

Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for sentencing. Court ordered case adjourned in branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Sarra Mae Kiaie for Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  ADA Torbenson is  in trial in another court.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

AS TO THE AMENDED CHARGE:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/08/15 in Branch 40.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 15CM417 and 15CF595 joined for the purpose of trial.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
State's Motion for Joinder received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  State to file motion for joinder by 4/20/15; defense to file response by 5/11/15.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pretrial scheduled for 5/20/15 at 8:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for 6/08/15 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for plea hearing.  Counsel informed Court there a conflict.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Court agreed to take this case as it is tied with 15CF595.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Alexis B Luster.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Court agreed to take this matter for resolution with 15CF595.    Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Alexis Bianca Luster.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has a pending felony in Branch 40.  Court will allow the transfer of this case to Branch 40 for Global Resolution if they will accept it.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 46. jks
  Status conference scheduled for 02-17-2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM004461  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-02-2015

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Rebecca N. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Danira S Cameron in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  
\Defendant Danira S Cameron in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
